  • numpy.polynomial.chebyshev.Chebyshev

numpy.polynomial.chebyshev.ChebyshevÂ¶

class numpy.polynomial.chebyshev.Chebyshev(coef, domain=None, window=None)[source]Â¶

A Chebyshev series class.

The Chebyshev class provides the standard Python numerical methods â€˜+â€™, â€˜-â€˜, â€˜*â€™, â€˜//â€™, â€˜%â€™, â€˜divmodâ€™, â€˜**â€™, and â€˜()â€™ as well as the methods listed below.

Parameters
coefarray_like

Chebyshev coefficients in order of increasing degree, i.e., (1, 2, 3) gives 1*T_0(x) + 2*T_1(x) + 3*T_2(x).

domain(2,) array_like, optional

Domain to use. The interval [domain[0], domain[1]] is mapped to the interval [window[0], window[1]] by shifting and scaling. The default value is [-1, 1].

window(2,) array_like, optional

Window, see domain for its use. The default value is [-1, 1].

New in version 1.6.0.
